summary: This document is a Warranty Deed and related property records showing the transfer of Great St. James Island in the U.S. Virgin Islands from GSJ Properties Corp. to Great St. Jim, LLC for $5,000,000 on January 2, 2016. It includes certifications from government offices confirming the transfer and tax clearance.

persons.name: Kevin F. D'Amour
persons.context: Signed the warranty deed as President on behalf of GSJ Properties Corp., the grantor selling the property.

persons.name: Jeannette Casey
persons.context: Attested the warranty deed as Secretary of the grantor corporation.

persons.name: Carrie DeLight De Leon
persons.context: Notarized the acknowledgment of the warranty deed signature.

persons.name: Erica Dover
persons.context: Recorded the warranty deed in the Office of the Recorder of Deeds for St. Thomas and St. John.

persons.name: Wayne D. Wood
persons.context: Certified the cadastral records for the property, confirming no boundary changes.

persons.name: Ludence Romney
persons.context: Certified a real property tax clearance letter stating no outstanding taxes for GSJ Properties Corp.

persons.name: Delbert Hewitt
persons.context: Certified a real property tax clearance letter for the Furst family's property interests.

persons.name: Helle Bungaard
persons.context: Previously conveyed the property to GSJ Properties Corp. via a warranty deed dated April 1, 2010.

persons.name: Steen Bungaard
persons.context: Previously conveyed the property to GSJ Properties Corp. via a warranty deed dated April 1, 2010.

persons.name: John Knud Furst
persons.context: Previously conveyed a portion of the property to GSJ Properties Corp. via a warranty deed dated April 1, 2010.

persons.name: Nina Furst

persons.context: Previously conveyed a portion of the property to GSJ Properties Corp. via a warranty deed dated April 1, 2010.

events.title: Property Sale of Great St. James Island
events.description: GSJ Properties Corp. sells Great St. James Island to Great St. Jim, LLC via a warranty deed for $5,000,000.

events.title: Previous Property Acquisition by GSJ Properties Corp.
events.description: GSJ Properties Corp. acquired the property from previous owners Helle Bungaard, Steen Bungaard, and the Furst family via warranty deeds.

events.title: Recording of Warranty Deed
events.description: The warranty deed for the Great St. James Island sale is officially recorded by the Recorder of Deeds, Erica Dover.

locations: Great St. James Island, No. 6A Red Hook Quarter, St. Thomas, Virgin Islands
5143 Palm Passage, Suites 18B and 198, St. Thomas, USVI 00802 (GSJ Properties Corp. address)
Royal Palms Professional Building, 9053 Estate Thomas, Suite 101, St. Thomas, VI 00802 (Great St. Jim, LLC legal representative address)
keyFacts: Great St. James Island was sold for $5,000,000 on January 2, 2016, from GSJ Properties Corp. to Great St. Jim, LLC.
The total property consists of multiple parcels totaling approximately 70+ acres on Great St. James Island.
GSJ Properties Corp. had originally acquired the property in 2010 from two groups of sellers: Helle and Steen Bungaard, and John Knud Furst, Nina Furst, and Kim Furst.
Government certifications confirm no outstanding property taxes and no changes to the property boundaries at the time of the 2016 sale.
The document shows a complex web of property ownership and transfer involving Virgin Islands corporations and LLCs, which is relevant for tracing asset movements in the Epstein case.
